name: Géraldine Pelissier
introduction: Most of my professional career was in Sales and Marketing for emissions-intensive sectors (automotive, telecom, oil and gas industries) to say the least…. But I always knew I had to look for a greater purpose. Covid19 slowed down my professional activities and helped me to follow my passion. I decided to open a new chapter and follow a new career path, but to do so, I had to study sustainability. I particularly like innovation and tech, so I wish to pursue my career with a tech for good angle.
top_3_advice: Brainstorm with your team to make them aware of the changes that need to happen in the organisation / Organise a Climate Fresk
Book your appointment with the The Matcha Initiative team for an executive Fireside chat :)
how_can_help: I have a broad visibility about the Sustainability players in France, so I can help users to make their first ESG assessment, find the right mentor or guide them in starting their sustainability journey.
sustainability_journey: Back into my 20's, my diploma thesis was 'how to Market Fairtrade'; at that time, I was already concerned about bringing more equity and sustainability to businesses that were doing the right things. Soon after, I joined a small enterprise in the UK, collecting leather waste from the automotive, furniture and shoe industry that had no value for those manufacturers, but a real one for other players, who were giving scrap a second life. We were not yet talking about circular economy or cradle to cradle at the time, but this was creating value, and decreasing waste. While in Malaysia, I helped to grow a marketplace for discarded IT equipment that were still of use in developing countries. These experiences have forged my belief that we can reverse Climate change but we must all act collectively NOW.

education.recommendation: Best for newly appointed sustainability officers or executives leading change
education.warning: Intensive academic program requiring significant time dedication

most_proud_of: I am proud to have joined The Matcha Initiative and help to grow the community of buddies, suppliers and fine-tuning its corporate offer to be fit for purpose and help SMEs accelerate their sustainability journey.
career_transformation: Transitioned from emissions-intensive sectors (automotive, telecom, oil & gas) to sustainability during COVID-19

Malaysia IT equipment marketplace for developing countries
